summary: The concept of "smart technology" encompasses advanced systems that utilize artificial intelligence, machine learning, and connectivity to enhance functionality and efficiency across various sectors. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, smart technology is subject to a range of directives and regulations aimed at ensuring safety, data protection, and ethical standards. The European Commission actively promotes innovation while balancing regulatory oversight to mitigate risks associated with emerging technologies. This includes compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the Digital Services Act, which govern the deployment and operation of smart technologies within the EU market, fostering a secure digital environment.
